alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gilchrist and northwestern Alachua Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alachua, or 12 miles northwest of Gainesville, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alachua, High Springs and Newberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
